metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Temp disks and cache for agent node pools in Azure Kubernetes Service clusters should be encrypted at host
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Both operating systems and data disks in Azure Kubernetes Service clusters should be encrypted by customer-managed keys
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed images
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster services should listen only on allowed ports
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster containers CPU and memory resource limits should not exceed the specified limits
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Azure Cosmos DB accounts should have firewall rules
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Azure Machine Learning workspaces should be encrypted with a customer-managed key
metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

The RegEx rule used to match allowed container image field in a Kubernetes cluster. For example, to allow any Azure Container Registry image by matching partial path: ^[^\/]+\.azurecr\.io\/.+$ and for multiple registries: ^([^\/]+\.azurecr\.io|registry\.io)\/.+$

metadata.displayName: Allowed service ports list in Kubernetes cluster
metadata.description: The list of service ports allowed in a Kubernetes cluster. Array only accepts strings. Example: ["443", "80"]

metadata.displayName: Max allowed memory bytes in Kubernetes cluster
metadata.description: The maximum memory bytes allowed for a container. E.g. 1Gi. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Max allowed CPU units in Kubernetes cluster
metadata.description: The maximum CPU units allowed for a container. E.g. 200m. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits
The list of locations that can be specified when deploying resources

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers for Guest Configuration policies
metadata.description: Optionally choose to audit settings inside Arc connected servers using Guest Configuration policies. By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.
The limit to how long a certificate may be valid for. Certificates with lengthy validity periods aren't best practice.

metadata.displayName: List of resource types that should have resource logs enabled
